Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the side effects of the Covid-19 vaccine by suggesting that it can cause prolonged erection and an increase in size.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or credible sources to support the alleged side effects.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the picture of the vaccination certificate is authentic and accurately represents the side effects.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the picture circulating on social media is not authentic and has been debunked by the hospital.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the picture is fake and doctored, as confirmed by the hospital and fact-checkers.
